title: 106_s432
content: The "Alcohol Abuse Prevention and Treatment Trust Fund Act of 1999" establishes the Alcohol Abuse Prevention and Treatment Trust Fund under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Alcohol Abuse Prevention and Treatment Trust Fund is created in the Treasury of the United States to fund the National Institute of Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism through appropriations from additional taxes received under the Alcohol Abuse Prevention and Treatment Trust Fund Act of 1999. The Alcohol Abuse Prevention and Treatment Trust Fund is created to fund programs for the prevention and treatment of alcoholism, research on health problems related to alcohol use, and related issues like high blood pressure, stroke, heart disease, cancer, and birth defects. A conforming amendment is made to the Internal Revenue Code. SEC. 9511 establishes the Alcohol Abuse Prevention and Treatment Trust Fund. SEC. 3 increases excise taxes on wine to match those on distilled spirits. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase tax rates on wines based on alcohol content. The amendments will take effect on October 1, 1999. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase tax rates on wines based on alcohol content. Effective October 1, 1999, a tax will be imposed on certain articles held for sale by any person at applicable rates of $1.90 per wine gallon for wine described in section 5041(b)(1) and $3.29 per wine gallon for other wines. The tax rates for wine based on alcohol content are $3.29 per wine gallon for certain wines and $2.93 per wine gallon for others. The tax applies to fractions of a gallon as well. The term "tax-increased article" refers to specific types of wine. No tax is imposed on certain small wholesale or retail dealers. Dealers holding up to 500 wine gallons of tax-increased articles on October 1, 1999, are exempt from tax if they provide required information to the Secretary. Liability for the tax applies to those holding tax-increased articles on that date, with payment methods specified. The tax imposed must be paid by March 31, 2000, in the manner prescribed by the Secretary. For controlled groups of corporations, the 500 wine gallon amount is divided among component members as regulated by the Secretary. The tax imposed by section 5041 of the Code must be paid by March 31, 2000, as prescribed by the Secretary. For controlled groups of corporations, the 500 wine gallon amount is divided among component members. The definition of "more than 50 percent" replaces "at least 80 percent" in certain instances. Principles similar to those in subparagraph (A) apply to nonincorporated dealers under common control. Other laws and penalties applicable to the tax on tax-increased articles under section 5041 of the Code also apply. The definitions for terms used in the subsection of floor stocks taxes are provided, including the meanings of "person" and "Secretary." The terms used in this paragraph align with those in subchapter A of chapter 51 of the Code.
